control.description-key: A Calendar view that can be used in both Model and Canvas apps. Ensure that any fields you define in the parameters are included in your view in a Model App or in your Collection in a Canvas app.

property.name: eventFieldName
property.description-key: Enter the Event Name field schema name which will be used to display on the calendar. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventFieldStart
property.description-key: Enter the Event Start field schema name which will be used to display on the calendar. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventFieldEnd
property.description-key: Enter the Event End field schema name which will be used to display on the calendar. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventFieldDescription
property.description-key: Enter the Event Description field schema name which will be used to display on the calendar. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventColor
property.description-key: Enter the Event Color Field schema name which will be used to display on the calendar. For related entities use the following format (new_entityname.new_fieldname)

property.name: eventDefaultColor
property.description-key: Specify the default background color for events if not using a field to define the color. Value should be in Hex color format, eg. #3174ad

property.name: eventId
property.description-key: For Model Apps this is not required but if you are using Canvas you will need to put in the Id field for the Events if you wish to use them.

property.name: resourceField
property.description-key: For a Model App put in the Lookup field of the Resource, for a Canvas app put in the field name that holds the Id of the resource.

property.name: resourceName
property.description-key: For a Model App this is not required but for Canvas apps if you are using resources enter the field name containing the Resources name.

property.name: resourceGetAllInModel
property.description-key: For Model apps only. If you select true and are using resources then this will ensure that all resources get returned, even those without events in the dataset

property.name: calendarTodayBackgroundColor
property.description-key: Specify the default background color for the calendar space displaying Today. Value should be in Hex color format, eg. #eaf6ff

property.name: weekendBackgroundColor
property.description-key: Specify the background color for weekends on the calendar. Value should be in Hex color format, e.g., #f5f5f5

property.name: calendarTimeBarBackgroundColor
property.description-key: Specify the default background color for the calendar time bar that displays on the week/day view. Value should be in Hex color format, eg. #ffffff

property.name: calendarTextColor
property.description-key: Specify the default color the text in the calendar such as the time/day/month. Value should be in Hex color format, eg. #666666

property.name: calendarBorderColor
property.description-key: Specify the default color the borders around the calendar components. Value should be in Hex color format, eg. #dddddd

property.name: calendarView
property.description-key: Allows you to choose the view that will be shown. Options are month, week, work_week, day, agenda.

property.name: calendarAvailableViews
property.description-key: Allows you to chose which calendar view button show up for the user. This is a comma delimited list of the view names which are month,week,work_week,day,agenda.

property.name: calendarWeekStart
property.description-key: Select the day the week should start on. If left blank or 0 this will be based upon your locale. (1=Sunday, 2=Monday, 3=Tuesday, 4=Wednesday, 5=Thursday, 6=Friday, 7=Saturday)

property.name: calendarWorkWeekDays
property.description-key: Select the days you would like to show on the work week. For example enter 2,4,6 to only show Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. If left blank it will display Monday-Friday. (1=Sunday, 2=Monday, 3=Tuesday, 4=Wednesday, 5=Thursday, 6=Friday, 7=Saturday)

property.name: calendarDate
property.description-key: Allows you to change the calendar date from a Date Field in Canvas Apps

property.name: calendarLanguage
property.description-key: Sets the language/culture of the calendar. In Canvas apps set this to the Language() function. In Model apps you can leave this blank and it will utilize the language set for the current users. Currently support lanuages are en, fr, de, es.

property.name: calendarScrollToTime
property.description-key: Enter the hour of the day (0 - 23) you would like the calendar to automatically scroll to for the day view.

property.name: calendarMinHour
property.description-key: Specify the minimum hour (0-23) to display on the calendar. For example, enter 8 for 8:00 AM.

property.name: calendarMaxHour
property.description-key: Specify the maximum hour (0-23) to display on the calendar. For example, enter 17 for 5:00 PM.

property.name: calendarStep
property.description-key: Specifies the interval (in minutes) for each time slot on the calendar. Default is 30 minutes.

property.name: calendarTimeSlots
property.description-key: Specifies the number of time slots per hour on the calendar. Default is 2.

property.name: dayLayoutAlgorithm
property.description-key: Sets the algorithm for arranging day events. Options are Overlap or No Overlap. Default is Overlap.

property.name: calendarSelectable
property.description-key: Allows users to select parts of the calendar. Disabling this prevents users from creating new records.

property.name: eventSelectable
property.description-key: Specify if events should be selectable in Model-driven apps. Set to true or false.

property.name: calendarPopup
property.description-key: When enabled, clicking on the +x more link will display events in a popup overlay.

property.name: eventHeaderFormat
property.description-key: Controls the display format of the event header (time) in the week and day views. Leave as 0 or empty for the default format, or set to 1 to hide the header

property.name: enableDragAndDrop
property.description-key: Allows users to drag and drop events on the calendar. Set to true or false. Default is false.

property.name: enableDragAndDropRecordCopy
property.display-name-key: Enable Drag and Drop Record Copy
property.description-key: Set to true to allow creating a copy when an event is dragged between days or resources; otherwise, the event is simply moved.

property.name: displayDragItemInCell
property.description-key: Set to true to display the dragged external item within the cell while dragging over the calendar.

property.name: outsideDropData
property.description-key: Custom data to be associated with an event dropped from outside the calendar.

property.name: selectedRecordId
property.description-key: When a record is selected this will be updated.

property.name: selectedSlotStart
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the start date.

property.name: selectedSlotEnd
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the end date.

property.name: selectedSlotResourceId
property.description-key: When an empty time slot is selected this will return the resource id if one is available

property.name: currentRangeStart
property.description-key: When the current calendar range changes the new Start will be returned.

property.name: currentRangeEnd
property.description-key: When the current calendar range changes the new End will be returned.

property.name: currentCalendarDate
property.description-key: Provides the current date the calendar is set to.

property.name: currentCalendarView
property.description-key: Provides the current view the calendar is set to.

property.name: dndRecordId
property.description-key: The record id for an event that was created or updated via drag and drop (DnD) or resize.

property.name: dndStart
property.description-key: The new start date/time for an event created or updated via drag and drop (DnD) or resize.

property.name: dndEnd
property.description-key: The new end date/time for an event created or updated via drag and drop (DnD) or resize.

property.name: dndOriginalStart
property.description-key: The original start date/time for an event before it was modified via drag and drop (DnD) or resize. (May be empty for new events.)

property.name: dndOriginalEnd
property.description-key: The original end date/time for an event before it was modified via drag and drop (DnD) or resize. (May be empty for new events.)

property.name: dndResourceId
property.description-key: The new resource id for an event created or updated via drag and drop (DnD) or resize.

property.name: dndOriginalResourceId
property.description-key: The original resource id for an event before it was modified via drag and drop (DnD) or resize. (May be empty for new events.)

property.name: dndName
property.description-key: The name or title of an event that was created or modified via drag and drop (DnD) or resize.

property.name: actionRecordResized
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that a record was resized.

property.name: actionRecordDropped
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that a record was dropped (via drag and drop).

property.name: actionRecordOutsideDropped
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that an event was dragged from outside the calendar and dropped.

property.name: actionSlotSelected
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that an empty time slot was selected on the calendar.

property.name: actionRecordSelected
property.description-key: Provides the Canvas app producer notification that a record was selected on the calendar.
